projects.title: CreditGoose - Invoice Financing App
projects.description: Developed during a fintech hackathon in Barcelona, this project helps small businesses access fast invoice financing. I contributed as a backend developer. Users can connect their Square account, send invoices, and receive automated funding suggestions powered by an integrated LLM (Goose + Gemini). The app was built collaboratively by a 5-person team using React, Tailwind, Node.js, and Express. Deployed on DigitalOcean App Platform.

projects.title: Nyam Nyam
projects.description: For my second project, I focused on applying React.js to create a platform for culinary enthusiasts. This project posed challenges, particularly with handling props and integrating frontend and backend. For the backend, I implemented Express.js and secured the app with JWT (JSON Web Token) authentication. I also used Postman to test the API routes. On the frontend, I used FontAwesome icons to enhance the user interface. The project aims to connect people based on their culinary preferences, offering them a platform to find suitable places. It is scalable, and improvements are ongoing, with new features being added.

projects.title: Historical Events
projects.description: This was my first project, where I applied my development knowledge to create a platform for history enthusiasts to comment and rate historical topics. I calculated the average ratings using a simple JavaScript formula. The backend was built with Express in Node.js, while the front-end utilized HBS for rendering. For password security, I used bcrypt for hashing, and the data was stored in a MongoDB database. I also incorporated Bootstrap to enhance the user interface and overall experience. It was a rewarding and humbling experience that allowed me to explore my passion for both technology and history.
